update.description:
This adds a tutorial about controlling the appearance of a model. It documents parameters related to color and textures. At the end it has an example using SDF, an ogre script, and collada file.

**Preview**
http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=color_model&branch=color_model
update.title: Add colors and textures to a model

pull_request.title: Add colors and textures to a model

pullrequest.title: Add colors and textures to a model

content.raw:
Would it be alright if I skipped addressing this comment? It would take some trial and error to find more distinguishable colors.

When I use brighter colors of the same shade then the final result is uniform color because all the pixels got clipped to 1.0, and if I use different shades then the final result is white so it's still hard to tell where the components came from. I'm sure there is a balance.
content.html:
Would it be alright if I skipped addressing this comment? It would take some trial and error to find more distinguishable colors.

When I use brighter colors of the same shade then the final result is uniform color because all the pixels got clipped to 1.0, and if I use different shades then the final result is white so it's still hard to tell where the components came from. I'm sure there is a balance.

content.raw: It may be worth it mentioning the model's parent directory must be in `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH`. Another option I've seen is to create the model under `~/.gazebo/models`
content.html: It may be worth it mentioning the model's parent directory must be in GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH. Another option I've seen is to create the model under ~/.gazebo/models
